snippet: A psychiatrist testified that Pedro Hernandez started abusing the drug in the mid-1980s and continued until 2005, when he quit, according to his medical records and toxicology test results.
abstract: Prosecutors in trial for 1979 murder of Etan Patz reveal that defendant Pedro Hernandez has history of cocaine use and domestic violence, possibly undermining defense's claim that Hernandez's hallucinations and odd behavior were due to personality disorder.
lead_paragraph: A psychiatrist testified that Pedro Hernandez started abusing the drug in the mid-1980s and continued until 2005, when he quit, according to his medical records and toxicology test results.

headline.main: Patz Trial Jury, in Blow to Defense, Is Told Suspect Was a Longtime Cocaine Addict
headline.print_headline: Patz Trial Jury, in Blow to Defense, Is Told Suspect Was a Longtime Cocaine Addict
